item.title: More than 100 killed in Indian religious event stampede, officials say
item.dc:creator: Anant Gupta, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The stampede at a religious event in northern India was among the country’s deadliest in recent years.

item.title: Israel orders Palestinians to evacuate parts of Khan Younis once again
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Louisa Loveluck, Rachel Pannett, Hazem Balousha
item.description: The evacuation orders will affect 250,000 people, many of whom have nowhere to go amid difficult conditions, warned the United Nations.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl tracker: Map and projected storm path
item.dc:creator: Nick Kirkpatrick, Dylan Moriarty, Szu Yu Chen
item.description: Beryl is expected to bring life-threatening winds and storm surge to the Windward Islands.

item.title: Hungarian leader Viktor Orban visits Ukraine and suggests a cease-fire
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Kate Brady
item.description: Orban has repeatedly blocked or weakened European efforts to provide Ukraine with security assistance throughout the war, frustrating its leader.

item.title: New Zealand, once a utopia for Trump-weary exiles, turns to the right
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: The populist National-led government is undoing many of Jacinda Ardern’s progressive initiatives, including gun control and environmental protections.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl at Category 5 strength after making landfall in Caribbean
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cappucci, Scott Dance, Ben Brasch, Samantha Schmidt, Anumita Kaur
item.description: Beryl shattered records as it strengthened in unusually warm waters, churning through Grenada’s Carriacou. It was predicted to skirt Jamaica on Wednesday.

item.title: Severe turbulence injures over 30, diverts Air Europa flight to Brazil
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih
item.description: Passengers described the incident to local media as “terrifying” and like a “horror movie.” Videos on social media showed damaged seats and overhead compartments.

item.title: This Israeli hostage mother supported Netanyahu. Now she wants him gone.
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin
item.description: Einav Zangauker, whose son Matan was kidnapped on Oct. 7, is at the forefront of anti-government protests calling on Israel’s prime minister to step down.

item.title: What happens next in French elections as far right leads in first vote
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack, Anika Seth
item.description: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections after a second round of voting.

item.title: As Macron fades and far right surges, French left senses an opening
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: Ahead of this weekend’s runoff election, France’s leftist alliance wants to recast itself as the primary competition to the rising far right.

item.title: Head of Gaza’s al-Shifa Hospital released after months of detention
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Miriam Berger, Hajar Harb, Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Pulled from a U.N. convoy, Mohamed Abu Salmiya’s detention bookended one of the most indelible chapters of Israel’s nine-month military operation in Gaza.

item.title: E.U. says Meta’s ‘pay or consent’ ads violate competition law
item.dc:creator: Eva Dou
item.description: Regulators say the tech giant breached the Digital Markets Act in requiring Instagram and Facebook users to pay if they don’t want personal data used to generate targeted ads.

item.title: Russia’s devastating glide bombs keep falling on its own territory
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina, Isabelle Khurshudyan
item.description: Internal Russian documents show how often its glide bombs hit its own territory, likely due to faulty guidance systems, say experts.

item.title: With ‘Make Europe Great Again,’ Hungary taunts allies, touts hard right
item.dc:creator: Emily Rauhala, Beatriz Ríos
item.description: Hungary takes up the rotating presidency of the Council of the European Union on Monday, putting the spotlight on Prime Minister Viktor Orban.

item.title: A 28-year-old is the face of France’s far right: Who is Jordan Bardella?
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Annabelle Timsit
item.description: Bardella joined the National Rally at 16 and was elected its president in 2022. He could become prime minister if his party wins an upcoming vote.

item.title: What Taiwan is learning from the war in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: For the Taiwanese public, the Russian invasion of Ukraine has revealed the dangers at their own doorstep, said Taiwan’s de facto ambassador in Washington.

item.title: French election projections show voters punishing Macron’s centrists, boosting far right
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack, Emily Rauhala, Annabelle Timsit, Anthony Faiola
item.description: Snap legislative elections could end French President Emmanuel Macron’s centrist political experiment and bring Marine Le Pen’s far-right party to power.

item.title: Gaza’s remaining hospitals will stop working in two days, health officials warn
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan, Claire Parker, Sarah Dadouch, Heidi Levine
item.description: Israel’s closure of the vital Rafah border crossing last month severed key supply lines, aid groups warned. Fighting goes on in Shejaiya, Gaza City, the IDF said.
